item.title: Org Mode Keywords vs. Properties
item.description: Once you start Programming Org Mode, you’ll probably want to manipulate keywords and properties. They’re different, and you use different tools to work with them. This post I’ve just started already has both keywords and properties at the file level. Properties live in :PROPERTIES: The (sole) property is in the :PROPERTIES: drawer: :PROPERTIES: :ID: 16b7ded8-3eda-444e-a419-b57a6e9e23a1 :END: Get an Org Mode Property You can retrieve that property programmatically with, e.g. (plist-get (org-element--get-global-node-properties) :ID) RESULTS:

item.description: Turn Org Mode into a Zettelkasten.

item.title: Zettelkasten
item.description: Grow your knowledge in a network of reusable thoughts.

item.title: Org Mode
item.description: “Your life in plain text.” I spend more time in Org Mode than any other program. It’s starting to feel like my personal, extensible mech suit. https://orgmode.org/ Programming Org Mode

item.title: pandoc
item.description: A most excellent tool for transmogrifying text.

item.title: AlphaSmart Neo2: Factory Reset
item.description: If you get a strange error on your Neo2, e.g. “File overflow”, try a factory reset. WARNING: You’ll lose all your files. But your Neo2 will work again. Turn off. Hold down Right Shift and Backspace Turn on. Enter password: tommy Confirm that you want to reset. Done. When You Might Need to Reset I had to learn how to do this reset after I changed the watch battery on a Neo2 I’d just purchased.

item.title: pandoc: Make a List of URLs into an Ebook (EPUB)
item.description: Next time you start a series of blog posts that looks compelling, why not take a minute and save it as an ebook? It’s easy with pandoc. Example: The excellent Hypermodern Python series. I’ve read published Python books with far less substance. Also the, illustrations are gratuitously fantastic. So let’s write a quick script and save ourselves a copy: pandoc \ -M title:"Hypermodern Python" \ -M author:"Claudio Jolowicz" \ -o Hypermodern_Python_22601.
